maximizeClaim.title: Maximize Your Claim
maximizeClaim.subtitle: Interactive 7-step guide to maximize your insurance claim

steps.title: Document Everything Immediately
steps.whatToDo: Take photos, save receipts, get estimates, and document all damage as soon as possible after the loss occurs.
steps.whyItMatters: Insurers exploit missing documentation to deny or reduce claims. Complete documentation is your strongest defense.

steps.title: Understand Your Policy
steps.whatToDo: Review your policy coverage, limits, exclusions, and special provisions. Know what you're entitled to under your contract.
steps.whyItMatters: You can't leverage rights you don't know you have. Understanding your policy helps you identify coverage gaps and insurer violations.

steps.title: Submit a Complete Claim Early
steps.whatToDo: File a fully documented Proof of Loss as soon as possible with all supporting documentation attached.
steps.whyItMatters: Incomplete claims lead to delays or denials. A complete claim forces the insurer to respond within statutory timeframes.

steps.title: Track Insurer Deadlines & Responses
steps.whatToDo: Note all important dates: claim filing, inspections, responses, and statutory deadlines. Most states require 30-60 day responses.
steps.whyItMatters: Missing deadlines can forfeit your rights. Tracking ensures you can hold insurers accountable for delays.

steps.title: Compare & Challenge Lowball Offers
steps.whatToDo: Get independent contractor estimates and don't accept the first offer. Insurers often test with lowball offers to see what you'll accept.
steps.whyItMatters: First offers are typically 30-50% below fair value. Independent estimates provide leverage for negotiations.

steps.title: Escalate Strategically
steps.whatToDo: Use appraisal, complaints, or appeals when appropriate. Timing and strategy matter for maximum leverage.
steps.whyItMatters: Escalation increases leverage but must be done strategically. Wrong timing can hurt your position.
steps.aiAssist: Appraisal Demand Letter or Appeal Letter

steps.title: Leverage Professionals When ROI is Positive
steps.whatToDo: Hire public adjusters or attorneys only for large or disputed claims where their fees are justified by increased recovery.
steps.whyItMatters: Professionals can increase payouts by 20-40% but take a percentage. Calculate ROI before hiring.

bonus.title: Bonus Tips - Stay Organized
bonus.whatToDo: Keep a detailed claim diary, don't sign releases early, and regularly recheck your policy benefits and coverage.
bonus.whyItMatters: Organization prevents mistakes and ensures you don't miss opportunities or deadlines.

insuranceTactics.title: Insurance Company Tactics
insuranceTactics.subtitle: Learn about common insurer tactics and how to counter them

tactics.title: Delay Until You Give Up
tactics.whatInsurersDo: Drag out inspections, ignore calls, request endless documents.
tactics.yourMove: Keep a Claim Diary, send a Notice of Delay Complaint.
tactics.aiAssistTool: Claim Diary Generator, Notice of Delay Complaint

tactics.title: Misinformation & Confusion
tactics.whatInsurersDo: Use technical policy language or misinterpret terms.

tactics.title: Deny First, See Who Fights Back
tactics.yourMove: File an appeal with supporting evidence.

tactics.title: Lowball Offers
tactics.yourMove: Compare with contractor estimates + ROM Estimator; demand fair payment.

tactics.title: Refuse or Stall Payment of Covered Benefits
Misapply Standards & Exclusions
tactics.whatInsurersDo: Call damages "wear and tear" or "not medically necessary."
tactics.why: Shifts burden of proof back to you.
tactics.yourMove: Provide expert reports, demand appraisal if applicable.
tactics.aiAssistTool: Appraisal Demand Letter, Medical Necessity Appeal

tactics.title: Quick but Low Settlement Offers
tactics.whatInsurersDo: Offer fast check upfront (fraction of true claim).
tactics.why: Hoping you take it and waive rights.
tactics.yourMove: Compare to ROM and refuse until full valuation.

tactics.title: Withholding Certified Policy Copy
tactics.why: Prevents you from knowing hidden coverages.
tactics.aiAssistTool: Certified Policy Request Letter, Policy Analyzer
